svcproc.title: Steering Axis Inclination

note.para: Refer to the specifications from the manufacturer of the vehicle for the steering axis inclination specifications.

svcproc.para: Steering axis (or king pin inclination) is the angle measured between the center line of the knuckle cap and the vertical position (as viewed from the front of the vehicle) (Figure 62).

The steering axis inclination and the camber angle are designed into the axle to place the tire tread center line in contact with the road. This reduces steering effort and improves directional stability.
Use an alignment machine to check the steering axis inclination angle. Refer to proper inclination angle specifications from the OEM vehicle manual.
The steering axis inclination is not adjustable. If the inclination is not at the specified angle, check the axle beam and knuckle for damage. Service as necessary.
